image.altText: A single-story house with a large gum tree branch fallen on the roof, causing damage.

props.synopsis: After a tree branch that Canberra resident Terrylea Reynolds had repeatedly reported as being dangerous fell on her house, she's hopeful a law update will help stop the same thing happening to others.

title.children: Terrylea reported a concerning tree. Then its branch fell on her house

image.altText: Andrew Barr press conference

props.synopsis: The federal opposition's assurance it won't pursue forced redundancies to reduce the size of the public service is met with scepticism from its political opponents in the ACT.

title.children: 'I don't believe them': Barr criticises Coalition public service policy

image.altText: TAX CUTS Peter Dutton, Jane Hume, Angus Taylor 20240206_012902354_iOS

props.synopsis: Jane Hume joked that the private sector might follow the Liberals in cracking down on work from home, but the party ran into trouble when voters came to fear the same.

title.children: How Dutton's work-from-home crackdown came undone

image.altText: Woman wearing a black t-shirt in a gym using a leg press machine.

props.synopsis: For many people who live with migraine, exercise has been reported as a trigger for attacks. But studies also show that exercise can be prescribed as a non-medical treatment that could decrease their frequency, intensity and attack duration.

title.children: For people with migraine, exercise is a 'double-edged sword'

image.altText: Artist's impression of a building with people walking in front.

props.synopsis: The federal and ACT governments would split the cost of early works for a new convention and entertainment centre in Canberra if Labor is re-elected next month.

title.children: Labor promises $100m for Canberra convention centre if re-elected

image.altText: A gate post with bullet holes in it.

props.synopsis: A NSW cattle farmer is calling for buffer zones to prevent licensed hunting on the border of private properties amid a police investigation into a bullet hitting his parked truck.

title.children: 'Won't just be vehicles': Farmer's safety fears as hunting bullet hits truck

image.altText: Rohan Goyne in a blue-gray polo shirt with the collar turned up, sitting down and holding papers

props.synopsis: GP bulk billing rates in the ACT have declined since the pandemic, and federal government figures have cast doubt on whether a national target to bulk bill nine out of ten GP visits will be met.

title.children: Rohan struggles to pay GP bills. He's hoping that will change

image.altText: Three women standing together.

props.synopsis: For residents of Altadena, hopes of rebuilding their community just as it was are facing mounting challenges.

title.children: In fire-ravaged LA, a land grab threatens to change the face of the city

image.altText: A line chart shows share prices falling after the announcement of tariffs.

props.synopsis: Share markets around the world take a battering as Donald Trump's new tariff regime creates a wave of uncertainty.

title.children: Stock Market tracker: See how ASX and US stocks are faring under Trump

image.altText: Teen mental health counselling

props.synopsis: More Australians will have access to free mental health support under a $1 billion promise from federal Labor, which seeks to put affordable health care at the centre of its re-election pitch.

title.children: Federal Labor pledges $1 billion in mental health support if re-elected

image.altText: A focus group

props.synopsis: A new series takes viewers inside a focus group where undecided voters displayed little enthusiasm for Prime Minister Anthony Albanese nor Opposition Leader Peter Dutton.

title.children: 'He's got a cool name': Inside a focus group of undecided voters

image.altText: ASX boards

props.synopsis: Australian stocks are on the rise after heavy losses, while investors worry about an economic slowdown and rising inflation as US President Donald Trump digs in his heels on tariffs. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX lifts and Asian markets climb after tariff turbulence on Wall St

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: What are the top performing stocks today?
All Ords up 2% as Asian markets bounce

image.altText: Am aerial shot of a house with solar panels along the top and two people standing on the lawn.

props.synopsis: The Consumer Action Law Centre has used its new powers to make a "super complaint" to demand a ban on door-to-door sales, an issue they say has harmed vulnerable people for decades.

title.children: Christine wishes she'd never let the solar salesman through the door

image.altText: A man in a suit stands before a row of US flags

props.synopsis: The current market sell-offs similarities to the global financial crisis are uncanny and unnerving.

title.children: With $110b wiped from Australian stocks, the spectre of the GFC has appeared

image.altText: Blue background with black grid and piles of coinsincreasing in height with a shadow.

props.synopsis: Around half of Australians' superannuation balances are invested in global and local stocks, meaning the tariff-induced market ructions are hitting super savings. Here's why experts say it's not time to panic.

title.children: 'It's happened so quickly': Super balances hit as markets tumble

props.synopsis: Paris Tier, the partner of GWS defender Conor Stone, found herself in her GP’s office asking to go on Ozempic after receiving online hate comments about her weight.

title.children: AFL partners divulge ‘lifelong body dysmorphia’ from online trolling

image.altText: Kaitlyn Torpey and Mary Fowler celebrate

props.synopsis: Mary Fowler has played a starring role in attack as the Matildas completed a 2-0 win over South Korea in their second international friendly.

title.children: Mary Fowler magic leads Matildas to victory over South Korea in friendly

image.altText: A grey-colouered tadpole close up with little round black eggs in its mouth, hovering over sandy-coloured small rocks.

props.synopsis: By removing a gene to stunt cane toads at their tadpole stage, scientists hope they may have found a way to make the invader kill its own species.

title.children: Cannibal cane toad tadpoles that never grow up could help toad control

image.altText: A miner standing in front of a processing plant.

props.synopsis: The spot prices of gold have never been higher, topping $5,000 an ounce for the first time last week. That has Australian miners ramping up production, trying to take advantage of lofty price forecasts.

title.children: Inside Australia's new gold rush as miners cash in on record prices

image.altText: An old Palestinian man stands at a lectern with news microphones in front of him.

props.synopsis: The Palestinian Red Crescent Society releases more video of the moments before Israeli forces opened fire on a convoy of paramedics and emergency workers.

title.children: Israeli probe into medic killings can't be trusted, Red Crescent says

image.altText: A woman poses for a selfie.

props.synopsis: Forensic testing has confirmed that human remains found in south-west Queensland belonged to missing mother Tayla Spies.

title.children: Missing mother confirmed dead after human remains discovered

image.altText: dredge barge pumping sand onto shore with beachgoers watching from sand

props.synopsis: Work is underway to replace the 4 million cubic metres of sand that washed away from the city's beaches during ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred.

title.children: Sand pumping begins to restore Gold Coast's eroded beaches

image.altText: A woman with brown hair sits at a sunny desk with her eyes closed, massaging her temples

props.synopsis: Dealing with perimenopause symptoms can be confusing. Our health experts will be here on Friday April 11 to answer questions about how to navigate this phase of life.

title.children: Perimenopause has a big impact on your life. Ask our health experts your questions

image.altText: An aerial view of a wharf part of the Darwin Port, with the city of Darwin in the distance.

props.synopsis: A former NT minister has defended the 99-year lease of the Darwin port to a Chinese-owned company, as both the Coalition and Labor promise to return it to Australian hands.

title.children: ‘China was the Asian tiger’: Darwin port 99-year lease deal defended

image.altText: Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: The Coalition has walked away from its working from home policy and plans to sack public service employees while everyone on the campaign trail is wondering who leaked an announcement to Labor.

title.children: Dutton on the hunt for a leaker who torpedoed his port plans

image.altText: An Asian woman, a blonde woman, a man in security uniform, woman with a dog, a young blonde girl and a European woman.

props.synopsis: The families of those killed in the Bondi Junction stabbings have backed a coronial inquest, after father of a victim and prominent businessman John Singleton called for it to be shelved.

title.children: Families 'support' Bondi Junction stabbing inquest despite Singleton's criticism

image.altText: Aerial view of the outline of a submerged boat, with a small boat moving over it on the water's surface.

props.synopsis: A New Zealand military inquiry has found a lack of training and experience were among factors that led to the sinking of a navy vessel off the coast of Samoa.

title.children: 'Not really doing what I want it to do': 'Human errors' caused NZ Navy sinking

image.altText: Men and women wearing red doctor shirts while holding signs and protesting.

props.synopsis: The industrial action centres around claims of unsustainable workloads, chronic understaffing and low pay, with the union expecting up to 9,000 doctors to take part.

title.children: Thousands of public hospital doctors walk-off job in NSW

image.altText: A baby zombie rides a chicken in the new Minecraft movie

props.synopsis: As younger generations flock to short-form video content, traditional film and television producers are trying to get creative.

title.children: A Minecraft Movie's viral moment sheds light on shift in film industry

image.altText: A woman slumps in front a laptop.

props.synopsis: Ever scrolled on your phone during a work meeting? Scientists say that actually might be a good thing.

title.children: Scientists say being distracted when learning might actually be a good thing

image.altText: A man smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: A Hobart obstetrician and gynaecologist who has been working in Tasmania for more than 20 years has had his registration suspended by the medical industry's regulatory body while it investigates complaints.

title.children: Tasmanian obstetrician and gynaecologist suspended, investigation underway

image.altText: Sunset behind mining operation, candy cane coloured chimney

props.synopsis: Mining company Glencore is assessing the future of its copper processing assets in Mount Isa and Townsville, with almost 700 direct jobs at risk.

title.children: Glencore seeks bailout as Australia's copper supply chain falters

image.altText: Luke McGregor stands in front of a pink background, awkwardly doing a thumbs up

props.synopsis: With practically countless comedy acts descending on Australia for comedy festivals, it can be impossible to know where to start. We asked our favourite comedians for their top picks.

title.children: Who is your favourite comedian's favourite comedian?
